issue.title: Valet 3.2.0 breaks custom drivers that extend built-in drivers
issue.body:
In Valet 3.1.x, you could do this:

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends LaravelValetDriver {
```

or

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends WordPressValetDriver {
```

and this is what was recommended [in the documentation](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/valet#local-drivers).

As of Valet 3.2.0 (and 3.2.1 does not fix this), this does not work.

> **Fatal error:** Uncaught Error: Class "WordPressValetDriver" not found in /Path/To/Site/LocalValetDriver.php

However, if you reference the full namespace `\Valet\Drivers\LaravelValetDriver` or `\Valet\Drivers\WordPressValetDriver`, it will work again.

I can update my custom drivers, but it really seems like this was an unintentional breaking change.

comment.body:
This should be fixed here:
https://github.com/laravel/valet/releases/tag/v3.2.2

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

comment.body: OK, sounds good! :)

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

comment.body:
@driesvints I'm not fully sure what you're asking. Let me state it different way, maybe?

What is *normal* for me would be:

If Valet is serving from `public/` then all files in the root should be totally un-serve-able; the *only* way Valet should ever serve files from the root is if that project doesn't have a `public/` directory.

But that's not the case right now.

`

I also run the following commands and restarted my iMac, without luck.

```
composer self-update
composer global update
brew upgrade
```

comment.body:

Please test it out and close if fixed. Thanks!

pull_request.title: Re-work how BasicValetDriver serves files in projects with and without `public/` directory
pull_request.body:
Closes #1309.
Replaces #1303.

Requires a bump to v4 because it's backwards compatibility breaking if someone was relying on the old behavior (which can be seen described in #1309).

I split off `BasicValetDriver` and `BasicWithPublicValetDriver` so sites with `public` are better corralled in terms of what files they serve, and so that both drivers can be much simpler.

issue.title: Test Valet commands
issue.body:
This is a first attempt at https://github.com/laravel/valet/issues/1233. I've split up the app init for Valet into a separate `cli/app.php` file which can be re-used in the test suite. This will run the actual commands using the `ApplicationTester` class by Symfony.

Unfortunately I couldn't get the first commands I'm trying to test to work and would appreciate any help with this.

comment.body:
OK, I think this is working.

The main output of ALL of this code and ALL of these commits are: 

Before this, we could only test our individual classes, but not the commands themselves.

Now, we can actually test commands. 

For example:

https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1256/files#diff-38057577cc680f5c7b83f3688b196a18ed53d744d984789303e8503373acd629

commits.message: Merge branch 'test-valet-cli' of github.com:laravel/valet into test-valet-cli

Update all output() calls to use the writer passed in by the command

Ugly capture of all $outputs from commands, by passing them into `writer()` to be bound into the container, where they can then be pulled out from calls to `output()` and its buddies `info()`, `table()`, and `warning()`.

Set files path as a static path for concrete5 driver

Previously testing a concrete5 site that had tons of 404s and required file based sessions would force each request to load sequentially causing the site to load pretty slowly. This change makes it so that the driver is aware of the files directory and markes anything within as a static file.
Disable brew auto cleanup on installation

Prevent 502 errors when using AJAX

When using the Laravel DebugBar with the `capture_ajax` flag set to `true`, its AJAX request monitoring exceeds the FastCGI buffer limit. This results in Nginx throwing a 502 Bad Gateway exception. 

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251)
Add parameters to adjust buffer size
use getStub to allow custom stub files

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. pull_request.body:
When using the Laravel DebugBar with the `capture_ajax` flag set to `true`, developers may encounter 502 Bad Gateway errors. This is due to DebugBar's AJAX request monitoring exceeding the FastCGI buffer limit.

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251).

In Brew.php line 140:

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

issue.title: check public dir for php file
issue.body:
Currently the public directory is not searched for the requested php file.

Example directory structure:
```
- my-project
|- public
 |- myscript.php
 |- index.php
```

A `GET http://my-project.test/myscript.php` would currently execute `my-project/public/index.php` because the `myscript.php` file is only searched at the `$sitePath`, which in this case is `my-project/`.

comment.body:
Interesting. I'm leaning toward thinking that if we have `public/index.php`, *all* files should serve from there, which would mean your note about appending `public` to `$sitePath` would be our best option, even if it may be a breaking change.

Let me think about this and get back to you soon. Thanks for catching this!

issue.title: Enable local network sharing
issue.body:
This PR enables a rudimentary version of local network sharing with the fix mentioned in (https://github.com/laravel/valet/issues/440#issuecomment-579830736). This pull request was suggested in (https://github.com/laravel/docs/pull/8267) by @driesvints.

I've tested the fix locally and it does enable local network sharing, though it's rudimentary at best since assets don't load properly given the URL doesn't match.

For example, if I have `http://laravel.test` and access is via local network sharing `http://192.168.1.111/laravel.test`, the site does load. But the asset URLs will use `http://laravel.test` and thus not load. I'm not sure if that is due to the `@vite` directive or something else. The same thing happens with the `asset` helper, which might be because of the `APP_URL`.

I did manage to get the CSS, JavaScript, and HMR working with Vite by starting the Vite server using the local IP address passed in as the host.

```bash
npm run dev -- --host 192.168.1.111
```

Since Vite adds the IP address in the `script` and `link` files, the IP address used for the host must be an address that can be accessed by all devices over the network, The safest route is to use the same IP address of the device you're trying to expose.

Not sure how to go about fixing the issue of built assets not loading due to the URL not matching though. 🤷‍♂️

comment.body:
I'm good with this modification, but I'll need someone who uses nip.io to test it out for me first.

Put out a request: https://twitter.com/stauffermatt/status/1598332500056621062

issue.title: Add support for custom site domains to valet php and valet composer
issue.body:
Fixes #1272

Adds support for passing in a custom sitename via the flag `--site=sitename`
- Could be more flexible, at this point the '=' is mandatory
- Command help updated, arguments added etc
- Code is repeated in two place, I thought it more likely that potential flags / checks diverge over time and didn't want to prematurely abstract

Potential issues
- someone calling a php command that requires a "--site" flag has to encapsulate the whole command as a string to pass it in - e.g `valet php 'cms_cli do:thing --site=radsite.test' --site=radsite.test`

Other considerations
- It would be better if the isolate function wasn't so tied to dir names - keeping a config file of isolated sites vs just parsing nginx configs seems better to me in the long run but is a larger and more serious refactor of valet.

Please only send a pull request to branches which are currently supported: https://laravel.com/docs/releases#support-policy

issue.title: Secure custom domains
issue.body:
I have attempted a new pull request, one that includes a test and takes the feedback from [#1294](https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1294) into account. Apologies if this is simply an unwanted feature.

Update the domain() function to include the default TLD only if the $domain variable does not include a dot. This lets you secure custom domains, e.g. "valet secure [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/)". (You would also have to add [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/) to your hosts file and create a symlink or folder in the Valet site directory, of course.)

comment.body:
I don't see any value in Valet securing domains that Valet doesn't serve. Valet is structured around serving everything under one TLD and I think we should keep the API constrained to that.

Thank you for the PR, though!

issue.title: When formatting provided site name, only remove .tld if it's at the end
issue.body:
(copied from Issue #1298 for context):

**Description:**
TL;DR: If your site name contains your TLD (e.g. if your TLD is `.test` and your site name contains `.test`) it will be removed inappropriately.

In line with our regular site setup we have the same locally with valet:
- portal.test-work.test
- welcome.test-work.test

The moment it goes wrong is when I try to use the `isolate` option. Then I get an error: `portal-work isn't found as site name`. That is correct as it is indeed `portal.test-work`. The problem seems to be that `.test` is removed not just at the end, but just as it is found in the site name.

Searches on internet doesn't bring any solutions to the table.

**Steps To Reproduce:**
- add a link to your project with a specific site name in line with ours e.g. `portal.test-work`
- try to isolate the site with any php version
- you should get the error that the site name isn't found in the list of sites

**Solutions in this PR:**

- [x] Check if tld is at the end of the site name and, if so, remove it
- [x] Add corresponding test

Fixes #1295, Fixes #1298.

comment.body: Thanks @ErikDohmen!

issue.title: Valet 3.2.0 breaks custom drivers that extend built-in drivers
issue.body:
In Valet 3.1.x, you could do this:

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends LaravelValetDriver {
```

or

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends WordPressValetDriver {
```

and this is what was recommended [in the documentation](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/valet#local-drivers).

As of Valet 3.2.0 (and 3.2.1 does not fix this), this does not work.

> **Fatal error:** Uncaught Error: Class "WordPressValetDriver" not found in /Path/To/Site/LocalValetDriver.php

However, if you reference the full namespace `\Valet\Drivers\LaravelValetDriver` or `\Valet\Drivers\WordPressValetDriver`, it will work again.

I can update my custom drivers, but it really seems like this was an unintentional breaking change.

comment.body:
This should be fixed here:
https://github.com/laravel/valet/releases/tag/v3.2.2

@driesvints I'm not fully sure what you're asking. Let me state it different way, maybe?

What is *normal* for me would be:

If Valet is serving from `public/` then all files in the root should be totally un-serve-able; the *only* way Valet should ever serve files from the root is if that project doesn't have a `public/` directory.

But that's not the case right now.

commits.message: Merge branch 'test-valet-cli' of github.com:laravel/valet into test-valet-cli

Update all output() calls to use the writer passed in by the command

Ugly capture of all $outputs from commands, by passing them into `writer()` to be bound into the container, where they can then be pulled out from calls to `output()` and its buddies `info()`, `table()`, and `warning()`.

Set files path as a static path for concrete5 driver

Previously testing a concrete5 site that had tons of 404s and required file based sessions would force each request to load sequentially causing the site to load pretty slowly. This change makes it so that the driver is aware of the files directory and markes anything within as a static file.
Disable brew auto cleanup on installation

Prevent 502 errors when using AJAX

When using the Laravel DebugBar with the `capture_ajax` flag set to `true`, its AJAX request monitoring exceeds the FastCGI buffer limit. This results in Nginx throwing a 502 Bad Gateway exception. 

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251)

commits.message:
Prevent 502 errors when using AJAX

When using the Laravel DebugBar with the `capture_ajax` flag set to `true`, its AJAX request monitoring exceeds the FastCGI buffer limit. This results in Nginx throwing a 502 Bad Gateway exception. 

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251)
Add parameters to adjust buffer size

Merge pull request #1079 from mattkingshott/patch-1

Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251).

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

issue.title: check public dir for php file
issue.body:
Currently the public directory is not searched for the requested php file.

Example directory structure:
```
- my-project
|- public
 |- myscript.php
 |- index.php
```

A `GET http://my-project.test/myscript.php` would currently execute `my-project/public/index.php` because the `myscript.php` file is only searched at the `$sitePath`, which in this case is `my-project/`.

comment.body:
Interesting. I'm leaning toward thinking that if we have `public/index.php`, *all* files should serve from there, which would mean your note about appending `public` to `$sitePath` would be our best option, even if it may be a breaking change.

Let me think about this and get back to you soon. Thanks for catching this!

issue.title: Enable local network sharing
issue.body:
This PR enables a rudimentary version of local network sharing with the fix mentioned in (https://github.com/laravel/valet/issues/440#issuecomment-579830736). This pull request was suggested in (https://github.com/laravel/docs/pull/8267) by @driesvints.

I've tested the fix locally and it does enable local network sharing, though it's rudimentary at best since assets don't load properly given the URL doesn't match.

For example, if I have `http://laravel.test` and access is via local network sharing `http://192.168.1.111/laravel.test`, the site does load. But the asset URLs will use `http://laravel.test` and thus not load. I'm not sure if that is due to the `@vite` directive or something else. The same thing happens with the `asset` helper, which might be because of the `APP_URL`.

I did manage to get the CSS, JavaScript, and HMR working with Vite by starting the Vite server using the local IP address passed in as the host.

```bash
npm run dev -- --host 192.168.1.111
```

Since Vite adds the IP address in the `script` and `link` files, the IP address used for the host must be an address that can be accessed by all devices over the network, The safest route is to use the same IP address of the device you're trying to expose.

Not sure how to go about fixing the issue of built assets not loading due to the URL not matching though. 🤷‍♂️

comment.body:
I'm good with this modification, but I'll need someone who uses nip.io to test it out for me first.

Put out a request: https://twitter.com/stauffermatt/status/1598332500056621062

issue.title: Add support for custom site domains to valet php and valet composer
issue.body:
Fixes #1272

Adds support for passing in a custom sitename via the flag `--site=sitename`
- Could be more flexible, at this point the '=' is mandatory
- Command help updated, arguments added etc
- Code is repeated in two place, I thought it more likely that potential flags / checks diverge over time and didn't want to prematurely abstract

Potential issues
- someone calling a php command that requires a "--site" flag has to encapsulate the whole command as a string to pass it in - e.g `valet php 'cms_cli do:thing --site=radsite.test' --site=radsite.test`

Other considerations
- It would be better if the isolate function wasn't so tied to dir names - keeping a config file of isolated sites vs just parsing nginx configs seems better to me in the long run but is a larger and more serious refactor of valet.

<!--
Please only send a pull request to branches which are currently supported: https://laravel.com/docs/releases#support-policy 

If you are unsure which branch your pull request should be sent to, please read: https://laravel.com/docs/contributions#which-branch

Pull requests without a descriptive title, thorough description, or tests will be closed.

In addition, please describe the benefit to end users; the reasons it does not break any existing features; how it makes building web applications easier, etc.
-->

@aj-adl It's been a while since I looked at the isolation code. Could you give me an example of a configuration in which this would be necessary?

Thanks!

issue.title: Secure custom domains
issue.body:
I have attempted a new pull request, one that includes a test and takes the feedback from [#1294](https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1294) into account. Apologies if this is simply an unwanted feature.

Update the domain() function to include the default TLD only if the $domain variable does not include a dot. This lets you secure custom domains, e.g. "valet secure [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/)". (You would also have to add [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/) to your hosts file and create a symlink or folder in the Valet site directory, of course.)

comment.body:
I don't see any value in Valet securing domains that Valet doesn't serve. Valet is structured around serving everything under one TLD and I think we should keep the API constrained to that.

Thank you for the PR, though!

issue.title: When formatting provided site name, only remove .tld if it's at the end
issue.body:
(copied from Issue #1298 for context):

**Description:**
TL;DR: If your site name contains your TLD (e.g. if your TLD is `.test` and your site name contains `.test`) it will be removed inappropriately.

In line with our regular site setup we have the same locally with valet:
- portal.test-work.test
- welcome.test-work.test

The moment it goes wrong is when I try to use the `isolate` option. Then I get an error: `portal-work isn't found as site name`. That is correct as it is indeed `portal.test-work`. The problem seems to be that `.test` is removed not just at the end, but just as it is found in the site name.

Searches on internet doesn't bring any solutions to the table.

**Steps To Reproduce:**
- add a link to your project with a specific site name in line with ours e.g. `portal.test-work`
- try to isolate the site with any php version
- you should get the error that the site name isn't found in the list of sites

**Solutions in this PR:**

- [x] Check if tld is at the end of the site name and, if so, remove it
- [x] Add corresponding test

Fixes #1295, Fixes #1298.

comment.body: Thanks @ErikDohmen!

issue.title: Valet 3.2.0 breaks custom drivers that extend built-in drivers
issue.body:
In Valet 3.1.x, you could do this:

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends LaravelValetDriver {
```

or

```php
class LocalValetDriver extends WordPressValetDriver {
```

and this is what was recommended [in the documentation](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/valet#local-drivers).

As of Valet 3.2.0 (and 3.2.1 does not fix this), this does not work.

> **Fatal error:** Uncaught Error: Class "WordPressValetDriver" not found in /Path/To/Site/LocalValetDriver.php

However, if you reference the full namespace `\Valet\Drivers\LaravelValetDriver` or `\Valet\Drivers\WordPressValetDriver`, it will work again.

I can update my custom drivers, but it really seems like this was an unintentional breaking change.

comment.body:
This should be fixed here:
https://github.com/laravel/valet/releases/tag/v3.2.2

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

comment.body: OK, sounds good! :)

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

comment.body:
@driesvints I'm not fully sure what you're asking. Let me state it different way, maybe?

What is *normal* for me would be:

If Valet is serving from `public/` then all files in the root should be totally un-serve-able; the *only* way Valet should ever serve files from the root is if that project doesn't have a `public/` directory.

But that's not the case right now.

Closes #1309.
Replaces #1303.

Requires a bump to v4 because it's backwards compatibility breaking if someone was relying on the old behavior (which can be seen described in #1309).

I split off `BasicValetDriver` and `BasicWithPublicValetDriver` so sites with `public` are better corralled in terms of what files they serve, and so that both drivers can be much simpler.

issue.title: Test Valet commands
issue.body:
This is a first attempt at https://github.com/laravel/valet/issues/1233. I've split up the app init for Valet into a separate `cli/app.php` file which can be re-used in the test suite. This will run the actual commands using the `ApplicationTester` class by Symfony.

Unfortunately I couldn't get the first commands I'm trying to test to work and would appreciate any help with this.

comment.body:
OK, I think this is working.

The main output of ALL of this code and ALL of these commits are: 

Before this, we could only test our individual classes, but not the commands themselves.

Now, we can actually test commands. 

For example:

https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1256/files#diff-38057577cc680f5c7b83f3688b196a18ed53d744d984789303e8503373acd629

commits.message: Merge branch 'test-valet-cli' of github.com:laravel/valet into test-valet-cli

Update all output() calls to use the writer passed in by the command

Ugly capture of all $outputs from commands, by passing them into `writer()` to be bound into the container, where they can then be pulled out from calls to `output()` and its buddies `info()`, `table()`, and `warning()`.

Set files path as a static path for concrete5 driver

Previously testing a concrete5 site that had tons of 404s and required file based sessions would force each request to load sequentially causing the site to load pretty slowly. This change makes it so that the driver is aware of the files directory and markes anything within as a static file.
Disable brew auto cleanup on installation

Prevent 502 errors when using AJAX

When using the Laravel DebugBar with the `capture_ajax` flag set to `true`, its AJAX request monitoring exceeds the FastCGI buffer limit. This results in Nginx throwing a 502 Bad Gateway exception. 

This PR increases the size of the buffer. While it is not guaranteed to fix the problem, the increased buffer size should solve the issue for most developers. Further discussion on this subject can be [found in this issue on the DebugBar repo](https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-debugbar/issues/251)
Add parameters to adjust buffer size
use getStub to allow custom stub files

PHP 8.2 support (#1279)

issue.title: When serving a site from`/public`, Valet will also serve matching files from the project root, and shouldn't
issue.body:
In reviewing https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1303 I realized that Valet's `BasicValetDriver` has a behavior I'd like to end:

If your site structure looks like this:

```
├── public
│   ├── index.php
│   └── file-in-public.php
├── file-in-root.php
```

You can visit both `file-in-*` files publicly:

`mysite.test/public/file-in-public.php`
and
`mysite.test/file-in-root.php`

However, I would expect instead:

`mysite.test/file-in-public.php`

And that the `file-in-root.php` wouldn't serve at all.

I know this is a breaking change, but it feels like a helpful correction to a more reasonable behavior.

issue.title: check public dir for php file
issue.body:
Currently the public directory is not searched for the requested php file.

Example directory structure:
```
- my-project
|- public
 |- myscript.php
 |- index.php
```

A `GET http://my-project.test/myscript.php` would currently execute `my-project/public/index.php` because the `myscript.php` file is only searched at the `$sitePath`, which in this case is `my-project/`.

comment.body:
Interesting. I'm leaning toward thinking that if we have `public/index.php`, *all* files should serve from there, which would mean your note about appending `public` to `$sitePath` would be our best option, even if it may be a breaking change.

Let me think about this and get back to you soon. Thanks for catching this!

issue.title: Enable local network sharing
issue.body:
This PR enables a rudimentary version of local network sharing with the fix mentioned in (https://github.com/laravel/valet/issues/440#issuecomment-579830736). This pull request was suggested in (https://github.com/laravel/docs/pull/8267) by @driesvints.

I've tested the fix locally and it does enable local network sharing, though it's rudimentary at best since assets don't load properly given the URL doesn't match.

For example, if I have `http://laravel.test` and access is via local network sharing `http://192.168.1.111/laravel.test`, the site does load. But the asset URLs will use `http://laravel.test` and thus not load. I'm not sure if that is due to the `@vite` directive or something else. The same thing happens with the `asset` helper, which might be because of the `APP_URL`.

I did manage to get the CSS, JavaScript, and HMR working with Vite by starting the Vite server using the local IP address passed in as the host.

```bash
npm run dev -- --host 192.168.1.111
```

Since Vite adds the IP address in the `script` and `link` files, the IP address used for the host must be an address that can be accessed by all devices over the network, The safest route is to use the same IP address of the device you're trying to expose.

Not sure how to go about fixing the issue of built assets not loading due to the URL not matching though. 🤷‍♂️

comment.body:
I'm good with this modification, but I'll need someone who uses nip.io to test it out for me first.

Put out a request: https://twitter.com/stauffermatt/status/1598332500056621062

issue.title: Add support for custom site domains to valet php and valet composer
issue.body:
Fixes #1272

Adds support for passing in a custom sitename via the flag `--site=sitename`
- Could be more flexible, at this point the '=' is mandatory
- Command help updated, arguments added etc
- Code is repeated in two place, I thought it more likely that potential flags / checks diverge over time and didn't want to prematurely abstract

Potential issues
- someone calling a php command that requires a "--site" flag has to encapsulate the whole command as a string to pass it in - e.g `valet php 'cms_cli do:thing --site=radsite.test' --site=radsite.test`

Other considerations
- It would be better if the isolate function wasn't so tied to dir names - keeping a config file of isolated sites vs just parsing nginx configs seems better to me in the long run but is a larger and more serious refactor of valet.

issue.title: Secure custom domains
issue.body:
I have attempted a new pull request, one that includes a test and takes the feedback from [#1294](https://github.com/laravel/valet/pull/1294) into account. Apologies if this is simply an unwanted feature.

Update the domain() function to include the default TLD only if the $domain variable does not include a dot. This lets you secure custom domains, e.g. "valet secure [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/)". (You would also have to add [www.mywebsite.com](http://www.mywebsite.com/) to your hosts file and create a symlink or folder in the Valet site directory, of course.)

comment.body:
I don't see any value in Valet securing domains that Valet doesn't serve. Valet is structured around serving everything under one TLD and I think we should keep the API constrained to that.

Thank you for the PR, though!

issue.title: When formatting provided site name, only remove .tld if it's at the end
issue.body:
(copied from Issue #1298 for context):

**Description:**
TL;DR: If your site name contains your TLD (e.g. if your TLD is `.test` and your site name contains `.test`) it will be removed inappropriately.

In line with our regular site setup we have the same locally with valet:
- portal.test-work.test
- welcome.test-work.test

The moment it goes wrong is when I try to use the `isolate` option. Then I get an error: `portal-work isn't found as site name`. That is correct as it is indeed `portal.test-work`. The problem seems to be that `.test` is removed not just at the end, but just as it is found in the site name.

Searches on internet doesn't bring any solutions to the table.

**Steps To Reproduce:**
- add a link to your project with a specific site name in line with ours e.g. `portal.test-work`
- try to isolate the site with any php version
- you should get the error that the site name isn't found in the list of sites

**Solutions in this PR:**

- [x] Check if tld is at the end of the site name and, if so, remove it
- [x] Add corresponding test

Fixes #1295, Fixes #1298.

comment.body: Thanks @ErikDohmen!
